Name: Wife
Text: Couldn't resist my beautiful face, could ya dear?

Name: Detective
Text: (She looked like trouble. Most dames did. People called me old-fashioned for saying that kind of thing, but Ive never been proven wrong.)

Name: Detective
Text: (Still, when it came to putting on events for the city, there was no one better than the mayor's wife.)

Name: Wife
Text: Hello? You're staring? Do you have something to say?

Name: Detective
Text: Pardon my manners. Allow me to introduce myself. I make my money chasing down killers.

Name: Detective
Text: And I'm trying to decide if I'm face-to-face with one.

Name: Wife
Text: Excuse me? I suppose you're talking about the mayor?

Name: Wife
Text: I know we may seem like very different people, but the love we share is real. I'm lost without him.

Name: Wife
Text: I really thought he had what it took to change this city for the better!

Name: Detective
Text: Judging by the news, that respect may not have spread to the bedroom.

Name: Wife
Text: How dare you! I should have you removed right now...

Name: Wife
Text: But the truth is, I could use a little entertainment.

Name: Wife
Text: I spent all day preparing for the event. I hardly had time for trouble.

Name: Detective
Text: I think you're the kind of person who always has room for trouble in their schedule...

Name: Detective
Text: You may not be aware, but the campaign manager hired a sniper to shoot at the mayor.

Name: Wife
Text: Really, now? And you're not arresting him?

Name: Detective
Text: You need at least five brain cells to plot a real murder, and he's about two short.

Name: Detective
Text: No, that as a publicity stunt. But the point is, his sniper had a good vantage point of the backstage.

Name: Detective
Text: And he saw you messing with the trunk of the car right before the murder. Right where the suitcase was.

Name: Wife
Text: So what? Right before the explosion, you said?

Name: Wife
Text: The suitcase was already on the stage then. I couldn't have touched it then

Name: Wife
Text: I may have been looking at the trunk, but it can't be relevant.

Name: Detective
Text: Not if you flip this mystery around.

Name: Detective
Text: (What was the wife doing in the trunk?)

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: That's your big evidence! Ha! Pathetic!

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: (Maybe I'm following the wrong lead here...)

Dialog.Name: Wife
Dialog.Text: That's your big evidence! Ha! Pathetic!

Dialog.Name: Detective
Dialog.Text: (Maybe I'm following the wrong lead here...)

Name: Detective
Text: What do you think of this?

Name: Manager
Text: I think you're wasting my valuable time. You know, if you don't mind, I've really got a meeting to catch.

Name: Detective
Text: You'll have to let them know the only place you can meet them is in a cell.

Name: Manager
Text: Maybe you should look into a cell yourself! Cause you're mad if you think that proves anything!

Name: Detective
Text: (She might have a point. That doesn't really make any sense. Am I really ready to take this challenge on?)
